page.title: 01Cockermouth - an overview 1
page.content: Our survey area includes most of Cockermouth and the farmland to the east and south of the town. Cockermouth is a small market town of some 7000 people at the confluence of the rivers Derwent and Cocker in the Allerdale District of Cumbria. The major industries are in shoe and boot making, engine seals and brewing. Cockermouth is the centre for a predominately dairy farming area, with a two-day livestock market and abbatoir. The oldest part of the town lies on the southern bank of the River Derwent, whilst the major post-war housing development, both private and Council, lies to the south and south-west. Many people commute to work in the west coast towns, Keswick and at the B.N.F.L. Works at Sellafield, south of Egremont.
